key_points: Kyle Rittenhouse's defense team filed a mistrial motion accusing prosecutorial misconduct.
The motion will be moot if the jury acquits Rittenhouse of the five felony charges against him.
Rittenhouse, then 17, is accused of fatally shooting two individuals and wounding another during Kenosha unrest in 2020.
The defense accuses the prosecution of not sharing a piece of video evidence properly.
Assistant District Attorney Thomas Binger is specifically criticized in the motion.
Judge Bruce Schroeder has not held arguments over the defense motion in court since it was filed.
The defense's motion for a mistrial includes accusations against Binger for referencing Rittenhouse's silence post-arrest.
Binger is also accused of trying to introduce evidence barred by pretrial rulings.
Defense attorney Mark Richards accuses Binger of trying to provoke a mistrial.
The motion asks the judge to dismiss the case with prejudice so Rittenhouse can't be tried again.
